There is regular bus service to Quimbaya from surrounding towns like
and Armenia. A one way bus fare from Armenia to Quimbaya is 2,400COP.  A one way fare from Montenegro to Quimbaya is 1,200COP. The buses run 5:30AM-10PM.

It is easy and safe to take a taxi between towns. A fare between Quimbaya and Montenegro will cost between 12,000 COP and 20,000 COP depending on whether you know the taxi driver, the time of night, and if your destination is far from the center of town.
Within town it is very easy to walk everywhere.

value: Granja de Mama Lulu, a sustainable farm 2km from town.

On the main square in Quimbaya there is an Artesania mall with a variety of stalls.  Several artisans have their workshops there and you can order custom made shoes, sandals and leather work.
Several coffee shops in town sell their own roasts.  Aborigen on the main plaza or La Casa del Cafe on 6th Street.
There are several medium sized grocery stores in town where you can buy everyday items.

value: Street vendors sell arepas, plantains, empanadas, fruit, etc...
There are several restaurants around town: typical Colombian food, pizza, Chinese

The main square is lined with coffee shops, bars and juice bars.

value: content=This resort is located in the most gorgeous place. The owners make you feel as you are one of the members of their family. Great amenities, the most beautiful views from the rooms. You can choose different rooms. They have cabins on the air, regular cabins on the ground, suites or regular tower rooms. Beautiful landscaped golf course, stunning horses, friendly employees, great disco, the food is delicious at the restaurants, beautiful grounds. As Colombians say " Este hotel es 1A"
Medicina Familiar del Centro 7521521, CRA 8 No 16-06, Quimbaya.  Dr. Alberto Betancourth Damelines

There are many internet cafes all over town.  Some have cables you can plug into your laptop.  The average price per hour is 800COP.
